Audio Description: An illustration of an American GI being killed in action is the central focus of this World War II poster with the message that reads “Careless talk got there first.” The parachuting soldier in a camouflage combat uniform and helmet is falling on a battlefield. The soldier hangs from the straps of his parachute, his head bowed. There is red blood on his chest, where he’s been shot. The soldier’s body is limp as his brown boots touch the green grass. His right arm and hand are hanging limp, while his rifle is held to his bloody left hand by its white shoulder strap. In the cloudy blue sky behind the soldiers are a half-dozen white parachutes. Two airplanes jet across the sky, and in a distant field green and brown smoke rise from red fires. In large black block letters at the top of the poster are the words: “Careless Talk Got There First.”
Creator: United States. Army Service Forces. Adjutant General's Office; United States. Office of War Information
Description: Poster, 70 x 50 cm, artist: Herbert Morton Stoops

Title: Careless talk--got there first
